title: Internal Refactoring: Towards a Multi-Distribution Setup
raw_output: {'files_to_modify': ['setup.py', 'bin/localstack', 'localstack/cli/main.py', 'Makefile', 'localstack/dev/run/configurators.py'], 'reasoning': "1. setup.py: Directly references and writes to 'localstack/version.py', must be updated for the new directory structure (localstack-core/localstack). 2. bin/localstack: Main CLI entrypoint and launcher, manipulates sys.path to find the localstack module at repo root—must now look in localstack-core. 3. localstack/cli/main.py: The Python CLI entrypoint—needs to be moved/updated for module path changes. 4. Makefile: Build/install steps may reference 'localstack' in the root directory. Update to install and operate from 'localstack-core'. 5. localstack/dev/run/configurators.py: Contains many imports and some file/path references to localstack, needs importing/code path updates after move."}
